page.title: 18ALLOTMENT GARDENS.
page.content: Gardening is a popular pastime in the area and there are several allotment sites provided for use by keen vegetable growers. The Baddesley Ensor Parish Council rents land from the Dugdale Estate and relets plots on three sites in the village.The Estate lets allotments to individuals too. Rents vary between Â£7 to Â£15 per annum for a plot approximately 25 metres by 10 metres.Most gardeners spread manure,from the local farm,on the soil during the Autumn and then dig the plot,ready for Spring planting.They grow the usual vegetables and often flowers,such as dahlias. Several flower and vegetable shows are held in the area in September and there is a shield awarded for the 'Best Allotment'each year. A few allotment holders keep poultry, and one man rears pigs on two plots.
